intro: Malope malacoides subsp. stipulacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The species is noted for its drought tolerance and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
